dialogues.text: Saigo complies and sits down in the back. “= CAPTAIN TANIDA Men, we must. remember that we are the Emperor’s soldiers. We must now die illustriously and find our place at Yasukuni Shrine. This is our destiny. One of the soldiers sobs.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TANIDA
dialogues.text: Tennoheika Banzai!

dialogues.speaker: _ MEN
dialogues.text: Banzai! Banzai! Banzai!

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN TANIDA
dialogues.text: Pull your grenades men. There is silence. Finally, one of the soldiers shouts.

dialogues.speaker: SUICIDE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Tennoheika Banzai! He pulls the pin off his grenade, holds it to his chest. This starts a chain reaction. Saigo watches in horror as Nozaki pulls his GRENADE and EXPLODES. Saigo falls back away from the rest of the men. Captain Tanida takes his PISTOL out and SHOOTS himself in the head, falling over dead bodies. Shimizu has his hand on his grenade, but it shakes. He sits there frozen. Saigo retreats backward, heading for an outlet. Then he makes a run for it. Shimizu sees this, pulls out his pistol and follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Stop! : Saigo turns around. Shimizu has his pistol pointed at

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: You should die like an honorable soldier!

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Look, Shimizu,,we can still join the troops in the Northern caves.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Our orders are to stay here until death.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I heard General Kuribayashi himself give orders to escape. Shimizu hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I heard it on the wire. Shimizu still seems undecided.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Would we better serve the Emperor as dead men or if we continued fighting? Shimizu finally puts his gun down. They both run off through the --

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK OF CAVES 79
dialogues.text: - an intricate system of tunnels below Suribachi.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Where does this go?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Underground. It‘ll take us closer to Motoyama. Saigo and Shimizu make their way through the tunnels when they spot two other soldiers, PVIS. ONO and HASHIMOTO.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: Do you have orders to move back? Shimizu hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: HASHIMOTO
dialogues.text: Where’s the rest of your men?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: All dead.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: It’s the same with us. The tunnel narrows. Up above, they can hear the FOOTSTEPS of Marines running.

dialogues.speaker: HASHIMOTO
dialogues.text: There’s an outlet somewhere near here.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Shhhh.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE 1, (0.8)
dialogues.text: (in English) I can hear Japs below us.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE 2, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey guys, there’s a hole here. LIGHT pours through the tunnel. The men freeze. A BLAST OF FIRE from a tunnel hole enters the cave. Hashimoto, closest to the outlet, is set aflame. He SCREAMS in agony.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: Hashimoto! The flame consumes him. He rolls on the ground, but there is no putting the fire out. A GRENADE is tossed from above. Saigo pulls Ono back with him and the men turn and run back the way they came as the EXPLOSION rocks the narrow cave walls. Saigo looks back at the blocked passage way.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: Hashimoto!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ono looks disheartened as the men trudge through the tunnels, back the way they came.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: We’J1 have to find another way. We’ll go back to Suribachi. They continue to make their way through the tunnels when they hear Japanese SOLDIERS YELLING.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They turn a bend and see a group of soldiers, dragging a BATTERED AMERICAN MARINE{KID.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We got one!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Pulled him out of the ceiling! Soldier #1 yells at the Kid.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: So you thought you could blow us up, or burn us alive like the rest, did you? The Kid doesn’t understand a word. Ono joins the other soldiers, pulls him up by the scruff.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: You damn Americans killed Hashimoto! He punches the Kid and knocks him to the floor. Then he starts kicking him. Other members of the garrison join in on the kicking. The Kid trembles with fear.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Please! Soldier #1 takes out his bayonet and attaches it to his rifle. Ono follows his example. They close in on him and spear him. Shimizu watches frozen. Saigo turns away, unable to watch. Blood spurts on the walls as the Kid SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: ONO
dialogues.text: Dirty American! INT. COMMAND CENTER — NIGHT 81 Kuribayashi paces back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Have we heard anything more from the suribachi sector?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: No, sir. |

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Send out a messenger.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldier #1 leads Saigo and the rest of the men.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Oiso has ordered all survivors to rendezvous at. the East Main cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo, Shimizu, Ono and the other soldiers gather along with a large group of soldiers. A haggard looking LT. COL. OISO briefs them.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COL. OISO
dialogues.text: We will make a run for the Motoyama mountains. There is no cover for two kilometers. It’s every man for himself. He looks at the men.

dialogues.speaker: LT. COL. OISO
dialogues.text: See you on the other side. If not on this earth, in the next world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo and Shimizu stand waiting among the troops, ready to make their mad dash. ~

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: (whispering) Don’t run up with the herd. That’s where the enemy will aim their guns. Fall back behind and stay low.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: That’s cowardice!

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Call it what -yqu will, but there's no use for a dead soldier. Shimizu falls back slightly. Lt. Col Oiso lets out a YELL, leading the desperate charge. The troops follow, rushing out in an unorganized stampede. The night sky explodes with FLARES and ARTILLERY SHOTS. Lt. Col Oiso'’s short-lived charge ends as he falls to th ground. Others meet a similar fate. Saigo and Shimizu straggle from behind.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Keep down! Keep down! ‘Men continue to fall before them in a virtual bloodbath. A BARRAGE OF BULLETS hits the ground before them.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Get down! Saigo and Shimizu fall to the ground. The slaughter continues. Finally, the rapid FIRE slows as the number of men left standing diminishes.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Crawl forward. Shimizu and Saigo do a slow crawl along the ground.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Wait until the flares go out. The flares dissipate to black.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Now! They rush forward. A new flare goes up.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Get down!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They lie amongst dead Japanese soldier bodies. Another STRAFE. OF BULLETS hits the ground and Shimizu quickly pulls.a dead soldier's body over him for protection. When the flare dies out, they continue on. Other Japanese soldiers follow their example. Those whose movements are caught in the light of the flares are instantly shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and Saigo scramble up a mountain. They are covered with black, sooty sand, weary and exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Look! Saigo turns around to see the AMERICAN FLAG flying on top of Mt. Suribachi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi paces.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Have we heard back from the messenger to General Adachi?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: No, sir. He never came back. Kuribayashi looks perturbed.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: I'11 go out there myself.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: But, sir... He starts to head out. Lt. Fujita runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: General, Motoyama has a transmitter as well. Perhaps they have been able to receive a message. We should try there ‘first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and Saigo come to thé mouth of a cave. They hear the CLICK of a GUN.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: The password.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Nogi.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: Togo. The GUARD emerges and they are led into the cave. 88 INT. ITO’S CAVE - DAY 88 Lt. Ito stares out one of the gun ports of the caves towards the flag on Suribachi with anguish.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir, these men escaped from Mt. Suribachi. Lt. Ito looks at them harshly.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: What? The men stand at attention.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Shimizu, Yoichi reporting for duty, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Saigo, Katsuhiro.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: You escaped from Mt. Suribachi?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: How dare you! He pulls out his sword. All the men take a step back away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cepeeten te pes er eS 88 66.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: It was your duty to stay in your positions*until death! You should have died with your fellow troop members! You're both a disgrace. Get on your knees!

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: But, sir... He advances with his sword.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: I said get on your knees! Trembling, Shimizu and Saigo fall to their knees. Lt. Ito lifts his sword. Just as he does, Kuribayashi enters with Lt. Fujita.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Ito! Lt. Ito turns around, puts his sword down and salutes them.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: These men ran from Mt. Suribachi.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito, I gave the order that all survivors make their way to the North caves. I can’t have you decapitating my soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry, sir. It’s just... He looks towards Suribachi with the flag waving and sits down on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Suribachi has fallen. He puts his head into his hands. Saigo and Shimizu, grateful that their lives have been spared, retreat. to the back of the cave. Kuribayashi looks out towards Suribachi and sees the flag atop the mountain. He looks crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A barrage of BOMBS and SHELLING starts.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Now. that Suribachi has been taken, the enemy will maneuver all forces onto the hillside. Kuribayashi turns to Lt. Ito, puts a hand on his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Fight for your fallen brethren.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and Saigo, wiped from their ordeals, SNORE like two chainsaws. They are kicked awake by one of ITO’S SOLDIERs. ITO’S SOLDIER Get up! Shimizu and Saigo slowly get up. ITO’S SOLDIER Major General Sato is leading a general attack. Our men are to join him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But General Kuribayashi’s orders are to remain in the caves. ITO’S SOLDIER Lieutenant Ito says Kuribayashi is ‘a weak American sympathizer. INT. MOTOYAMA CAVES -— NIGHT 90 Lt. Ito gathers his force of about 25 soldiers together.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: We will take back Mt. Suribachi! Let us march! The soldiers follow behind him as he leads the way out of the caves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seegogreneti ooo 91 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito's men gather near the cemetery between airfields No. 2 and No. 3. They are behind a gathering of a large group of men, hopelessly disorganized, milling around in the darkness. Lt. Ito approaches one of them. Lt. ITO Where is Major General Sato?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: We don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Who’s in charge here? The Soldier looks around hopelessly.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Lt. Ito returns to his men.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Stay here until I determine the plan of action. Suddenly an undisciplined yell of “Banzai!” rings out, starting a chain reaction and the men in front of them stampede forward.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: (muttering) We're dead. Lt. Ito looks surprised by the movement. Almost instantaneously the sky lights up with star-shell FLARES, exposing the attackers. MORTAR ROUNDS throw up geysers of earth and ash. MACHINE GUNS pellet the men and they drop like flies. Lt. Ito, Saigo, Shimizu, and the rest of his regiment are pinned down, crouched behind rocks. BULLETS WHIZ in every direction. A man next to Shimizu attempts to get up but is immediately shot in the head, falling down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Pull back! Weil] get reinforcements. The men retreat and head back for the caves near Nidan Iwa, the area the Americans have dubbed Hill 382. EXT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE - NIGHT 92 Lt. Ito leads his team to the mouth of the cave. NISHI’S GUARD (0.8.) Nogi.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Togo. It’s Lt. Ito. NISHI’S GUARD lets him pass through.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Why didn’t your regiment join the attack? You’re not rats. Come out of your caves and fight! Where is your commander? Baron Nishi appears.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: There is to be no attack.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: What? General Sato sent the order.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi countermanded Sato’s order. There is to be no attack.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: We will take back Suribachi! With or without Kuribayashi. There are already troops on the attack. Get your men in order! This riles Baron Nishi.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHT
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, may I remind you of your rank. Your disrespect of your senior officers puts your men at needless risk and compromises the island’s general defense strategy.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BARON NISHI (cont'd) I suggest either you. go back to your cave, or hand over your men. Lt. Ito storms. out Bf the cave, cursing Nishi.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: (to his men) We'll do it ourselves. Shimizu turns to Saigo. .

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: (whispering) This is against rules. It’s mutiny to counter a senior officer.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Never trust a captain that tries to cut your head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMOKE rises from the field -- a surreal sea of dead Japanese soldiers on a dark battlefield. The men stare at the scene in shock. Lt. Ito sits down crestfallen. Finally, he gets up, faltering a bit.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: I won't go back. I’ve had enough of cave fighting. You men are now under Lieutenant Colonel Nishi’s command. Lt. Ito picks up an EXPLOSIVE and straps it to his back.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: I won't die before I take out at least one of their machines. Even if I have to throw myself under an enemy tank. The men look at each other in awe. Lt. Ito solemnly turns and leaves the men.. Lt. Ito staggers forth into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi takes counsel with his staff. Lt. Fujita walks in holding a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: What is the status?

dialogues.speaker: LT,. FUJITA
dialogues.text: A thousand men were lost ina night time skirmish along Chidori Airfield 1.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Wasn't my order not to lead a general attack conveyed?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: It seems the orders countermanding General Sato were not conveyed to all sectors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi pounds the table.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Damn that General Sato!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi paces.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: And the American advancement? LP. FUJITA ree A battalion is headed North as expected and meeting light resistance along Nishi ridge. Kuribayashi looks at a map. He outlines the Marine movement.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Good, then they are falling into our trap. Once they cross Nishi ridge, they will be surrounded on three sides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi looks at Fujita.

dialogues.speaker: . KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Have we received a response yet from Tokyo for reinforcements and te supplies? .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne vag ueventnecorss oa sgenepetee 94 95 96 97 72.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: This came in sir. “ He passes the piece of paper to Kuribayashi. Kuribayashi reads it gravely.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: (reading) ‘I regret that. we are unable to send reinforcements to Iwo at this time. However, in view of the overall requirements, I earnestly hope you will maintain calm and fight staunchly by all means.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito, with the bomb still strapped to his back, finds FIVE DEAD BODIES along what looks like a logical route of advancement. He settles himself among the dead bodies, FLIES BUZZING around him. He stares at the sky above in silence, waiting for the tanks to come. EXT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE - MORNING 96 GUNFIRE and TANK BLASTING ECHO through the mountains. Saigo and Shimizu are assigned the strenuous duty of loading a SPIGOT MORTAR. Loading and BLASTING. The SHELL makes a WHIRRING noise as it flies through the air. Three American tanks are taken out as they head along the 3rd Motoyama airfield. Now in the daylight hours, the Americans take a beating. Trying to advance along the airstrip, they are mercilessly slaughtered. One GRENADE-BEARING MARINE bravely rushes out, throwing a grenade into a fortified pillbox in the hillside. He is immediately SHOT down.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE 97
dialogues.text: LT. OKUBO, Nishi’s aide, notices movement directly below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: fy Be  97 98

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Look! - SAM, a lone American flamethrower, has somehow madé it through the front lines. He is about to spray a cave, when Okubo SHOOTS the marine and he falls. It is apparent he is still alive as he MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Bring him in. BARON NISHI’S CAVE ~ LATER 98 Okubo and Shimizu drag Sam in. He’s about Shimizu’s age, not more than 17 or 18.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Shall I finish him off?

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: No, have Medic Endo treat him. They look at him surprised. MEDIC ENDO turns from bandaging a minor wound on another soldier. OKUBO. But sir...

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: You would expect the same if it were the other way around, wouldn’t you? Medic Endo approaches them.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC ENDO
dialogues.text: We're short on morphine.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Sir, the Americans would not treat a wounded Japanese soldier. They would run him over with their tank treads.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: What. do you know of Americans? Have you ever met an American, young boy?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: I have. | (to™Medic Endo) Give it to him. The three begrudgingly comply and help Sam over to the back. The medic administers to his wounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito still lies patiently among the bodies waiting for a tank to arrive. 100 INT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE - NIGHT. 100 Baron Nishi takes a swig from a sake bottle. Sam lies on a bedroll, a bandage wrapped around his chest. ,

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: How is the prisoner doing?

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC ENDO
dialogues.text: He is awake.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: I will question the prisoner for information. Okubo looks at him suspiciously. Baron Nishi approaches Sam and converses with him in English.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: (in English) Where are you from, soldier?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: (weakly) Able Company --

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: No, I mean what is your home town? Tense, Sam doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHT
dialogues.text: I lived in California for a while. Do you know of Mary Pickford? Or Douglas Fairbanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the-mgvie stars? Why sure, everybody knows thém.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: I took my picture with them. It was in the papers. Sam loosens up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No kidding. You somebody famous?

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: I was in the Los Angeles Olympics. Sam’s eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is that the God’s honest truth? Baron Nishi beams. He pulls out a PICTURE.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: That's a picture of me and my horse jumping. Sam weakly tries to get up to see it.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: No kidding. (a beat) Oklahoma. That’s where I’m from. Baron Nishi holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHT
dialogues.text: Takeichi.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Sam. They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito is still among the bodies. Finally he gets up.

dialogues.speaker: LT. ITO
dialogues.text: Where are you American tanks? Come and get me! Silence.
An American soldier turns on a MILITARY RADIO.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: {in English) Turn it up, Charlie. The VOLUME is blasted LOUDLY. BIG BAND MUSIC. INT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE - MORNING 103 Saigo and the others pass around a cigarette, sharing puffs in the momentary calm. Shimizu holds a piece of a cracked mirror, looks at himself. He shaves his face smooth with a dry razor. Baron Nishi can hear the strains of the RADIO MUSIC. He goes over to Sam, who looks paler than the previous day.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: (in English) What is this music? Sam's eyes flutter, half conscious.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Swing music.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Swing music? Is it what they play in the clubs now? Listening to the MUSIC, Baron Nishi seems to be in another place and time. He looks to Sam, but there is no response. Baron Nishi looks to Medic Endo.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC ENDO
dialogues.text: He’s lost a lot of blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi also hears the FAINT MUSIC through the RADIO TRANSMISSION. In the dark cave, Kuribayashi doodles a picture of a dinner party.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: NIGHT - (1929) so ° An elaborate dinner party for the officers. MUSIC WAFTS through the hall. American officers and their wives mingle, dressed in formal attire. Kuribayashi is seated at a dinner table, looking awkward.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Taro, on Friday, there was a dinner party for the officers and their wives. Americans have a strange custom where men have to stop eating and stand every time a woman comes in. It makes no sense to me.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: is about to take a bite of his meal, when one of the OFFICERS’ WIVES walks to the table and all the men stand. Kuribayashi looks at them mid-bite, then puts his fork down and stands with them. They sit back down, but another woman enters and the men stand once again. Kuribayashi reluctantly stands with them. After they are all seated, a conversation carries over to Kuribayashi. OFFICER’S WIFE (in English) Let’s ask Captain Kuri. All turn to Kuribayashi. He is oblivious at first.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER'S WIFE
dialogues.text: You don’t mind me calling you Kuri, do you, Captain? Kuribayashi realizes she is speaking to him and looks up questioningly. :

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER'S WIFE
dialogues.text: How would you feel if America and Japan were to enter war?

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: I believe they would make splendid allies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SORRBOARA 5* Seenre ie o a

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: No, she means against each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The company is poised on Kuribayashi’s every word:

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: The United States is the last country in the world Japan should fight, but if this were to happen, I would serve my duty to my country. OFFICER’S WIFE Do you mean if Bertie here was on the opposite side, you would shoot him? Kuribayashi hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: I would have to follow my convictions.

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Do you mean you would have to follow your convictions? Or your country’s convictions. Kuribayashi hesitates again.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Are they not the same?

dialogues.speaker: AMERICAN OFFICER
dialogues.text: Spoken like a true soldier. OFFICER’S WIFE Oh that’s awful. Bertie, that means you’re dead. There is nervous laughter. END OF FLASHBACK. 106 “INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - MORNING 106 Kuribayashi, still sketching the dinner party, puts his pen down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 108 79. EXT. GULLY - MORNING - » . 107 Lt. Ito has once more settled himself among the dead bodies. He stares up into the sky. The distant strains of the RADIO MUSIC can still be heard. INT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE - MORNING 108 Baron Nishi notices Sam’s pale complexion. Baron Nishi comes to him.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: (in English) Hey. He touches him gently and realizes he is dead. Baron Nishi looks discouraged. He covers the boy’s body with a blanket. As he does so, he notices a PIECE OF PAPER in the soldier’s shirt pocket. He pulls it out. Okubo notices Baron Nishi pull out the paper.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Is there any enemy plan information?

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHT
dialogues.text: No, it’s just a letter. He reads through it.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: What does it say? Saigo, Shimizu, and other soldiers in the cave stop to listen to what the letter says.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: It’s from his mother. (translating) ‘I have mailed you a couple of books to read. I hope you like them. Yesterday, the dogs dug a hole under the fence. They ran all the way down the neighborhood and terrorized the Harrisons’ roosters before we found them.’

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Baron Nishi smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: ‘Don't worry about us. Just take care of yourself and come back safely. Remember what I said to you -- always do what's right because it is right. I pray for a speedy end to the war and your safe return.’ The soldiers are silent. Suddenly, a BARRAGE of SHELLING and GUNFIRE ERUPTS. The men, quickly go to their posts. They FIRE at the advancing Americans with MACHINE GUNS and RIFLES. Baron Nishi directs his men at the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo and Shimizu carry a mortar from the cave to reload their spigot, when a BOMB BLAST hits their machine, putting it out of commission. Another large BLAST hits the cave. Baron Nishi reels back, his face covered in blood.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Medic Endo! Medic Endo attends to Nishi. He opens his kit. It’s empty, except for a roll of bandage.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC ENDO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, sir. There's no more medicine. The medic covers Baron Nishi’s eyes with a strip of bandage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s all right. I’m useless anyway. Go help the others. Medic Endo complies, attending to other injured soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Ito stares into the sky. He has had two days to contemplate life beyond the war. A lone SEA BIRD flies overhead, small and fragile, making its way through the remnant smoke of bombardments, up into the darkening blue sky. A change comes over Ito and he starts to CRY. At last, he gets up. He unstraps the bomb from his back, and leaves it. He makes his way to a naturally formed cave and sits there on the ground CRYING. He wants to live. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - NIGHT 111 Kuribayashi looks at his strategic map of Iwo Jima. He crosses out Japanese positions that have been quashed by the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: LT, FUJITA
dialogues.text: Sir, supply planes have been spotted.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Are they ours?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Kuribayashi brightens.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: At last. EXT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - NIGHT 112 Kuribayashi watches off in the distance. The DRONE of JAPANESE PLANES can be heard. He smiles as he sees the cargo planes approach, bearing the unmistakable emblem of the red sun. His smile turns to dismay when one by one the planes are shot down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNNERS on ships, quickly home in on the lumbering Japanese planes and let out an ALL-OUT ASSAULT, sending the supply planes careening into the Pacific in horrific fireballs. Only two supply planes make it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two planes begin dropping their precious CARGO. A single string of a dozen PARACHUTES. Under the light of thousands of flares, the parachutes are as clear as day. EXT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE 115 Kuribayashi holds up his binoculars

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: They’re off mark! Off mark! Too close to the: line. Kuribayashi anguishes as he watches the life-saving supplies drop into unreachable zones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers spot the supplies parachuting. At first, they CHEER loudly. But as they land, the soldiers soon realize they are irretrievable. A few brave souls make a mad dash out towards the supplies, but are easy targets and are immediately GUNNED DOWN. INT. BARON NISHI’S CAVE ~ NIGHT 117 Baron Nishi feels around for his bottle of sake. It’s empty. He opens his canteen, shakes it, turns it over. _ It’s also. empty.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Okubo, come -here.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: we : Okubo obeys. _ Baron NISHT How are we on ammunition?

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Not good, sir. Our mortars have been taken out and we're out of machine gun ammo. We just have our rifles.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Okubo, listen. You're now in charge of the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: We can no longer hold this area. You must guide the rest of the men up to Kitano Point. They should hold out there as long as possible. Take whatever food and ammo we have left.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: But, what about you, Colonel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baron Nishi chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: I’m tired of sharing this cave with all of you. I’m a one man show from here on.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: But, sir..

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHE
dialogues.text: Okubo, you're trying my patience. Your first order of business should be to find some water.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Okubo bows in front of him, even though Baron Nishi can’t see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — OKUBO Sir, it has been a great honor to serve under you.
BARON NISHI’S CAVE —- LATER 118
Saigo and the men are packed up and ready tod leave the cave. They line up in formation. Okubo stands next to the bandaged Baron Nishi

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Bow! The men all bow to Baron Nishi, even though he can’t see them.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Do your best, men. Fight bravely for our Emperor and homeland, but above all.else, do what’s right because it’s right.

dialogues.speaker: MEN
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Okubo turns to Baron Nishi.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: I will ask General Kuribayashi to send a doctor and supplies to come to your assistance.

dialogues.speaker: BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: Thank you, Okubo. Okubo leads Baron Nishi to a stool to sit down on, and leaves a rifle in his hand. Okubo and the men slowly exit the cave, looking at Nishi as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: MEN/BARON NISHI
dialogues.text: The men make their way out of the cave. Baron Nishi pulls out a pistol and puts it to his head. The sound of SWING MUSIC wafts in the air, whether in his head or not, it is unclear. As the men make their way around the mountain, they hear a SINGLE GUNSHOT. Okubo pauses and the other men look at each other. Okubo continues on without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The soldiers. hunker down along a sand bank, close toa CONSTRUCTED WELL. They hold out their rifles in ready position. Saigo lies in the sand next to Shimizu. Okubo motions for two of the soldiers to move out. They quickly move out towards the well, holding two metal canisters each.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: They’ve got to make it. NIGHT FLARES light up the sky. The soldiers make it to the well without incident. They quietly fill their containers with the precious water. Saigo licks his lips. Back at the sand bank, the soldiers continue to look out for signs of the enemy, but all seems peaceful. Successful, they begin hauling the containers, when a bright WHITE LIGHT spots them and freezes on them. They try to duck down, but its difficult with the containers. Suddenly, the area explodes with RAPID FIRE. The two soldiers are gunned down. The men in the sand banks return fire, but they are outgunned. The METAL CANISTERS are RIDDLED with BULLETS and the precious water seeps into the ground,

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Damn! The soldiers watch as the water continues to seep. Dismay in their eyes. -

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Get Down! Move back! Move back! The men turn back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i z

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and saigo sit together. They both look frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Damn it, I’ve had it! I’m going to surrender. | He looks angrily at Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Go ahead and arrest me. I don’t care anymore. That’s what you were put here for, isn’t it? To report treasonous thoughts?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: No, you’re wrong. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I was put here because I was dismissed from the Kempeitai. Saigo looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Dismissed?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: That's right. For disobeying a senior officer. FLASHBACK — EXT. TOKYO STREETS - EVENING Shimizu and Captain Iwasaki walk along the streets of Tokyo.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I had only been in service for 5 days. Captain Iwasaki walks with Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: You must always be firm, Shimizu. Any hesitation and people will know that they can’t respect you. 86. 120 121

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. - They walk through the quiet village, not a soul on the street, only the sound of the imperial FLAG FLAPPING in the WIND in front of houses. All the houses, except one.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: That house does not have the flag displayed. Go sort it out, Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Shimizu runs up to the house and bangs on the door. A MOTHER opens the door. Her two CHILDREN cling to her and peer out at him. An AKITA behind a fence BARKS at him.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: (sternly) You do not have the imperial flag properly displayed, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. My husband has gone to war, and I couldn't put it up myself.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: It is unpatriotic not to have the flag displayed.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: If you help me, I’11 put it up now. Shimizu waits patiently as she brings out the flag. The dog runs to the fence and barks ferociously at Captain Iwasaki. The Mother appears with the flag for Shimizu. He attaches the flag to a pole extending near the roof of the house. . The AKITA continues BARKING at Iwasaki.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: Get that dog to shut up. The DOG continues to BARK incessantly.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: What’s that, sir?

dialogues.speaker: _- CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: That dog is a nuisance. It’s i disruptive of army communications. | i

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: I’m very sorry, sir. Pochi! Be quiet! Pochil She tries to drag the DOG away. It continues to BARK and GROWL at Captain Iwasaki.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: Shimizu, dispose of the dog immediately. We can’t have a dog interfering with important military commands. Shimizu pauses.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Ma’am bring the dog, please. The Mother looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It’s only a dog. It won't happen again. The children look at Shimizu, fearfully. The BOY runs to his dog and puts his arms around it.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Take it out back. Keep the children inside. Captain Iwasaki looks bored. The Mother complies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother brings the Akita out back on a leash. Shimizu ties the leash to a fence. . Shimizu aims his gun at the dog. Cocks the trigger. Aims. The dog looks at him, wagging it’s tail. At the last moment, Shimizu SHOOTS in the air.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shimizu looks at the Mother. 4

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Take the dog into the house and keep him quiet. Don’t let him out again.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Thank you, sir. She pulls the dog inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu emerges from the back.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: It’s taken care of, sir.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: Good. They start to leave, when a BARK is heard from inside the house. Shimizu’s face falters. Captain Iwasaki looks back at him. Angrily, Iwasaki marches back to the door. He bursts in without knocking. Momentarily, a SHOT is heard along with a sharp WHIMPER. A commotion is heard inside, with the MOTHER SHOUTING along with CHILDREN CRYING. Shimizu closes his eyes. Captain Iwasakai emerges. from the house and storms out towards Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: Are you trying to make.a fool out of me?

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: No, sir. Captain Iwasaki strikes Shimizu with a force that sends him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: £ g

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN IWASAKI
dialogues.text: If you can’t even shoot a. dog, you'll never be able to handle the Reds. END OF FLASHBACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo looks at Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I was dismissed for insubordination and sent here.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Don’t look so glum, Shimizu. At least now only the enemy hates you. Saigo and Shimizu chuckle. Then Shimizu becomes quiet again. .

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: It was just an innocent thing. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - NIGHT Kuribayashi paces restlessly.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Why am I not getting any reports? Have we heard from Admiral Ichimaru or General. Sato?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: What about the 26th Tank Regiment or the 145th? Lt. Fujita is silent.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Send out messengers.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: We have, sir. None of them have come back. 123 125

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHL
dialogues.text: (angrily), We need to find any remaining troops and have them put up a defense position near the commanding post. How can I command a garrison that I can’t see or talk to?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troop trudges through the scarred mountains, silent and sedate. They come into a secluded valley with shelled out pillboxes and caves littered with bodies of DEAD JAPANESE soldiers, some charred beyond recognition. SMOKE still rises from the flamethrower's trail.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Check the caves for food. The soldiers comply and a happy SHOUT from one of them indicates success. The soldier brings out a canister and the men congregate around him, grabbing uncooked rice from the canister with their hands and gulping them down hungrily. Some of the rice falls to the floor and the men grovel for it. Saigo and Shimizu grovel with the others on the ground. Saigo chokes on the rice.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Are you all right? Shimizu and Saigo fall back. Saigo sits on the ground, COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: This is not the life a human being should suffer, Shimizu. Shimizu looks at him, understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee 127 92. INT. NATURAL CAVE — DAY 127 The men are hunkered in a cave , Sleeping out the dayligh hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu, lying next to Saigo, whispers to him. |

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Saigo? Saigo rolls over.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I have been thinking about what Lieutenant Colonel Nishi said. That I've never even met an American. It’s true. I don't know anything about the enemy. Shimizu looks towards the cave ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I was taught that the American soldier is weak, but he is not. I was told that they are savages, but that American who died -- his mother writes the same things that my mother would write.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I guess we’re all just soldiers doing our job.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I want to do my duty to my country and my God, but I don’t want to die for nothing. Saigo is silent.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: What do you think, Saigo? Tell me what you think.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: People tell us we serve God by dying a valorous death on a battlefield. I don’t know much, but if you ask me, I think God would be more pleased if we lived to experience the world He created. You’re still young, Shimizu.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAIGO (cont'd) You haven’t seen enough sunsets to appreciate all the beautiful shades of orange that change with each minute -of ‘each dusk: You haven’t been to enough village festivals to taste their local flavors and to discern the subtle differences in their obon dances. You haven’t been with a woman long enough to recognize her curves and valleys and to hear the sound of a baby’s heart beat--your baby’s heart beat beneath the skin of her belly. Shimizu, you haven’t even begun to experience life to know what you are sacrificing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Shimizu’s cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Saigo, will you surrender with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men crawl on their hands and knees. They have found a new bounty in the soil outside of the naturally formed cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dig through the earth and whenever a beetle or worm is found, they pick it up and eat it. Saigo and Shimizu whisper, separated from the rest of the men.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: We'll have to be careful. They’11 notice if we leave together. You go on first. 1'11 say that you've got dysentery. After a while, I‘1l1 tell them I’m going to check on you to make sure you're all right and then I'll join you. By the time anyone notices, we’ll be long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu nods.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Now give me your dysentery look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHIMIZU eee What? . ! FEEL

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: You have to look like you’re sick. 7 Shimizu scrunches his face into a half frown, his eyelids flutter.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I said sick, not stupid. shimizu tries a different expression.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I guess that’1l have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo monitors the rest of the troops as they mill about. He signals for Shimizu to leave. Shimizu steals his way from the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu runs out of the cave. PRIVATE 2ND CLASS KANDA, another soldier, relieves himself on the hillside and makes his way back to the cave. He sees Shimizu leaving.

dialogues.speaker: KANDA
dialogues.text: Where are you going? Shimizu pauses.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: I’ve got dysentery. He puts on his dysentery face. Kanda stares at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: KANDA
dialogues.text: You're going to surrender, aren't you? Shimizu doesn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: KANDA
dialogues.text: If you are, take me with you. Shimizu looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: KANDA
dialogues.text: I've had enougp of this war.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. They start to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo notices that Shimizu has left behind his lucky thousand-stitch belt along with his pack. Saigo picks it up gravely. Okubo spots Shimizu and Kanda.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Hey! Where are those two going? He gets out of the cave and watches Shimizu and Kanda making their way away from the cave. Saigo quickly follows after him.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO \
dialogues.text: I think Shimizu said something ” about not feeling well. He has dysentery, sir. Okubo ignores Saigo.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Hey, you two stop! The two start to run.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Stop! He picks up his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Sir, maybe they just got spooked by something. ‘An animal or a sound --

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: I said stop! He SHOOTS and Kanda is hit, falling on the spot. Shimizu . continues running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Miura, you’re on guard. Make sure this. doesn’t happen. again. MIURA, one of the soldiers, nods his head. Saigo looks crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINES are gathered at their position, smoking cigarettes, awaiting orders. A NOISE in the distance causes them all to be on the alert, raising their rifles. Shimizu appears before the marines, with his hands up, a torn piece of his white undershirt in his hand. The soldiers approach him, shouting at him with their rifles pointed. The Americans surround him. Shimizu falls to his knees. They search him for weapons. Finding none, they let him stand back up. Shimizu makes a motion for water. One of the marines hands him a canteen and Shimizu drinks thirstily. Shimizu’s hands are bound and he is taken to an area where another PRISONER also stands with his hands bound. They look at each other in surprise. The Marines receive an order over their wire.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in English) We’re moving out!

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: What about the prisoners, sir? Marine Officer points to MARINE #3 and MARINE #4.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE OFFICER
dialogues.text: You two stay behind and keep watch. The two CURSE at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and the other Prisoner are seated on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: Which unit are you from?

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: 20th Special Machine Cannon Unit. We ran out of ammo and then they overtook us. I’m the only survivor. I heard Americans have real hot food.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: It would be nice toe eat food again. He licks his lips. In the b.g., the Marines assigned to keep watch discuss their situation in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: {in English) What. a bum rap. We’re not going to be stuck watching ’em all night, are we?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Maybe we can take them back to the beach,

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? We'd be sitting ducks with those two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shimizu and the Prisoner are still talking.

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: I live in Yokohama. After this is over, you can come visit me.

dialogues.speaker: SHIMIZU
dialogues.text: That would be nice. The two Marines approach the two prisoners. They hold up their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Unsuspecting, Shimizu and the Prisoner look up. The Prisoner is immediately SHOT. Shimizu GASPS in surprisé. Shimizu is SHOT next. His body goes still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okubo ledds the troops out of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okubo notices FOOTPRINTS. Another spots a SPENT CIGARETTE. Okubo motions for the men to encircle the area. They cautiously approach the area with their rifles drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once they see that no one is there, they relax their rifles and check out the area.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Lieutenant! Okubo comes to where the Soldier motions. Shimizu and the other Prisoner’s bodies lie dead in a make-~shift ditch. The other soldiers approach. Saigo sees the body of his friend. He drops into the ditch and picks up Shimizu’s pale and lifeless body.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Let this be a lesson to anyone else who wants to surrender. Saigo is in tears..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men leave the area, two fresh BURIAL MOUNDS behind them. Saigo looks numb and listless as the soldiers trudge on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men gather around volcanic fumeroles with containers and jars.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They try to capture the steam in the containers, then lick them for any bits of, condensation. , SAIGO . You need to wait until there is enough condensation. The men ignore him, trying to get the drops into their mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okubo has his men enter the cave.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: We'll be at Kitano Point tomorrow. We'll sleep out the daylight hours here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sleeping men are awoken by the pattering of

dialogues.speaker: CAVE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: It’s raining! He gets up and rushes towards the entrance of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Get back here! The soldier halts. He peers through the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Look! I can see it! Unable to contain himself, he rushes out. The others follow to the entrance. A SINGLE SHOT is heard. Upon hearing this, the others pull back. A LOW RUMBLING is heard.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: CAVE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Thunder? The sound gets LOUDER and LOUDER.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Bulldozers. a

dialogues.speaker: CAVE SOLDIER
dialogues.text: They're coming this way. i

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Get back! Get back! The men run towards the rear of the cave. They keep their eye out towards the mouth of the cave. A GRENADE is thrown in and the men hug the wall. The GRENADE EXPLODES, causing dirt from the roof to fall, but the men are safe. The BULLDOZERS continue to come CLOSER and CLOSER, starting a RUMBLING VIBRATION throughout the whole cave. The bulldozers shovel dirt over the entrance of the cave. The natural light dissipates, until everything is pitch black. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - DAY 141 In Kuribayashi'’s cave, the sound of the BULLDOZERS can also be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of the BULLDOZERS PASSES. In the darkness, someone lights a match.

dialogues.speaker: CAVE SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: They’ve buried us alive.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: Then we'll dig. We dug in these caves, so we can dig out of them. Okubo feels the walls of the cave.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: The soil is soft here. We can dig an exit hole. Form a line. The soldiers form an assembly line. They start to dig with their rifles and their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At last, the soldiers have dig through a hole, just wide enough to escape through. They scrape more of the dirt out and one of the soldiers pops his head out. He looks around cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men trudge forward, haggard and limping. They come upon an impasse. A line of Marines SHOOTING towards the caves.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: We need to get through the crossfire to reach Kitano Point and- join our forces on the other side. He draws a map in the sand.

dialogues.speaker: OKUBO
dialogues.text: There’s no way in without passing through open area and getting shot at. So we’ll go to this nearby cave and make our way from there. We'll have to pass through the rear line of the enemy. We can’t avoid a confrontation. The men make their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men prepare themselves for the run to the caves. OKUBO. We'll have to make every bullet count, so don't shoot recklessly. The soldiers make a rushing charge for the hills. GUNFIRE ERUPTS.. Okubo leads the charge. He SHOOTS down two Americans. Men go down on both sides. Saigo rushes forward, nervous. Running quickly in a zig zag motion, he is able to dodge BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8 g

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Okubo pulls the trigger of his PISTOL, but it CLICKS empty. He throws the pistol down. A group of Americans aim their rifles towards him. Okubo pulls a grenade, yells and charges straight at them. !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans send a BARRAGE OF BULLETS, riddling Okubo’s body before he falls towards them. Okubo’s GRENADE EXPLODES. Saigo and other troop members manage to cross through, running towards the safety of a cave. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - DAY . 146 FOOTSTEPS RUNNING along the corridor alert Kuribayashi and his staff. They all stand with worried expressions. A GUARD appears.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir, survivors of the 26th Tank Regiment are here. Saigo and his men, dirty, haggard and suffering effects of malnutrition, make their way down the tunnel. Kuribayashi looks at them amazed.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Are there no officers? Where is Lt. Colonel Nishi? The men are silent. Kuribayashi looks genuinely saddened.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: I see, Well, you all did a good job making it over here. He looks at the sad state of the men.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Fujita, what’s the status of our water rations? The men look up eagerly at this. Lt. Fujita falters.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Fujita?

dialogues.speaker: LT.. FUJITA
dialogues.text: There are no water rations, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: What about the groups we sent out yesterday for water?

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: None came back. The men go back to their dejected states. Kuribayashi looks disheartened.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Well, come and rest.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. The men find a place to sit down. Devoid of energy. Kuribayashi looks at Saigo.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: You look familiar. Aren’t you the one whose head I saved?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I am eternally grateful.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: It’s a miracle that you've made it this far.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: That was the second time, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: The second time?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: That was the second-time you saved me. The first time was on the beach the day you arrived. Kuribayashi laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Is that so? Well, everything 2 comes in threes. So I may have to ! save you again.
Saigo and the men rest on the floor of the cave. Some of the men look deathly ill. A medic checks the pulse of some of them and cover the ones that are dead. Saigo writes on a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hanako, I know you will probably never see this letter, but it comforts me to talk to you. We have been without food or water for five days now. We are going through unspeakable measures to keep ourselves alive. One of the men gets up, pees into a cup. Then, grimacing, he drinks his own urine.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There seems to be no way out now. I have tried my best. I worry about who will take care of you and the baby. Lt. Fujita enters the cave. Lf. FUJITA You there. Dig up some worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi writes out his last wire.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI., (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The battle is approaching its end. Since the enemy’s landing, even the gods would weep at the bravery of the officers and men under my command. Now there is no more ammunition, no more water. All the survivors will engage in a general attack. Praying to God for the final victory and safety of our motherland, let me say “sayonara” everlastingly... Saigo enters the room. He brings in a pitiful plate of worms, cut into sections.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: There wasn’t-mych we could dig up, sir. - > -

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Thank you. Saigo is about to leave.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHT
dialogues.text: Saigo.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir?

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: It was quite a journey you’ve made all the way from Suribachi.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: You must be quite a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Oh ho, sir. I am just a simple baker. I don’t know much. —

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHTI
dialogues.text: You’re a baker?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Well, I was one back in Yokote.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Do you have family back home?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Just my wife and a little baby girl born last summer. I haven’t seen her yet.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Funny, Saigo, I have just realized that the irony of being a soldier is that what compels us to do our duty is our families and it is likewise the thought of our families that makes it difficult to fulfill it. Kuribayashi is quiet for a moment. He takes out a Chinese song book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: g

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: t

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHIT
dialogues.text: Saigo, do you like Chinese poetry?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: I'm afraid I don’t know much about poetry, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Would you like to stay and listen?

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I would like that. Kuribayashi motions to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Sit down. Saigo complies. Kuribayashi begins singing translated Chinese poetry.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: ‘No end to this marching, forever and ever... In life we are separated from one another, Parted by a. thousand and ten thousand li, Each a different corner of the sky, The road so long, so perilous. Who knows when we shall see each other again?’ Saigo listens quietly. Tears begin to run down his face. _ Kuribayashi stops when he notices Saigo crying.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Sorry, sir. Kuribayashi nods, closes the book. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - NIGHT 149 The remaining rag tag group of soldiers gather in formation in the cave. Kuribayashi addresses them. His voice is weaker than in days past.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Our garrison.wjll make a general attack against “the enemy. Starting time will be 0600 hours. Until now, you men have overcome any and all difficulties, obeyed my orders and fought gallantly against an . enemy with overwhelming supplies. The loss of this island means that Yankee military boots: will soon tread on our motherland. However, you can all be proud that you have acted as honorable warriors of the Imperial Empire, fighting to the last. No one is to return from this mission. Kill as many enemies as possible and fight for your seventh life. The soldiers look glum, knowing they are to die. Saigo looks especially disheartened.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHIT
dialogues.text: Dismissed. The soldiers fall out. Lt. Fujita approaches Kuribayashi.

dialogues.speaker: LT. FUJITA
dialogues.text: Sir, we are getting a radio transmission from Japan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of a STATIC-FILLED BROADCAST can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is a special song for General Kuribayashi and his men fighting bravely at Iwo Tou from the children of his hometown in Nagano Prefecture. The voices of schoolchildren singing the “Song of Iwo Defense” plays over the radio.

dialogues.speaker: SCHOOLCHILDREN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ‘Where dark tides billow in the ocean, A wink-shaped isle of mighty fame, Guards the gateway to our empire: Iwo Jima is its name...’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: x

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi breaks down. EXT. NEAR KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE ~ MORNING 151 Saigo, with a force of about 300 rag tag men - many without guns, but holding swords or sticks, are gathered at the entrance to the cave. Kuribayashi inspects them.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Shuppatsu! The troops start to exit the cave and make their way down the slope, looking haggard, but determined. Kuribayashi stops Saigo.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Saigo, you will remain here. I have another task for you. Saigo looks surprised.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: You see, everything comes in threes, INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - MORNING 152 Kuribayashi and Lt. Fujita gather all of their documentation -- plans, code books, maps, etc.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Saigo, start a fire and make sure all of these documents are burned.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The troops rush forward, giving their last energy into their run towards the enemy. The Marines and workers are surprised by the attack, some resting in their cots.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The last of Kuribayashi’s force wield their instruments holding nothing back. - . Some are shot down, but not before wreaking their own havoc. EXT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - MORNING 154 Kuribayashi, with Lt. Fujita at his side, watches with binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE 155
dialogues.text: Saigo has a fire going, places all the documentation into the fire. As he picks up a stack of papers, numerous drawings fall to the floor. Saigo looks at them. They are Kuribayashi’s sketches.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAVE 156
dialogues.text: The CRIES of DYING FIGHTERS ECHO through the canyons. Kuribayashi puts down his binoculars, sadness in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: AIR FORCE AND SEABEE ENCAMPMENT 157
dialogues.text: The camp is littered with dead bodies. The Americans, now awake and alert, have taken the upper hand and overwhelm the remnants of the Japanese army with artillery.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAVE 158
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi turns to Fujita. He hands Fujita a samurai sword. A secret pact between them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAVE 159
dialogues.text: Saigo continues burning documents. He comes upon a LEATHER SATCHEL, full of mail. It is filled with undelivered postcards and letters. He places his letter to his wife into the sack, along with Kuribayashi’s sketches.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is about to throw the whole thing into the fire, then stops. . . There is a depression in the floor where supplies had been kept. He takes a shovel and starts digging the hole wider.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi faces north toward the Imperial Palace. He kneels on the ground and bows three times. Lt. Fujita stands above him, still holding the samurai sword. INT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - DAY . 161 Saigo finishes burying the mail sack into the ground. WE SEE it is the same leather satchel as was uncovered in the first scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi pulls out a hara-kiri knife. He strips his shirt off.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Forgive me Emperor for my failures. Kuribayashi takes a deep breath, then thrusts the knife into his abdomen. In his weakened state, he is unable to pierce his stomach, making only a scratch. Yelling, he continues to thrust the knife into himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As. smoke fills the enclosure, Saigo emerges from the entrance to the cave. He hears KURIBAYASHI’S YELLS and heads towards the direction of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi finally makes a deep enough incision, then pulls from left to right. Blood spurts out. His face is contorted in pain.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fujita lifts his sword up to do the final honors of chopping off his head. - y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MARINE SHARPSHOOTER, alerted by the smoke coming from the cave, does a survey across the hiil and spots the two men. He sees Fujita lifting his sword to chop the head off of Kuribayashi. Shocked, he picks his RIFLE up and aims through the scope for Fujita. He SHOOTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fujita falls over dead. Saigo witnesses this, falls to his knees in shock. Kuribayashi is dying a painful death, blood pouring out of his guts. Saigo ducks down onto the ground and approaches Kuribayashi.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: General Kuribayashi.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: (struggling) Tell me, Saigo, is this still Japanese soil? Saigo looks out upon the landscape, eerily desolate and silent, filled with smoke and bodies of the dead. SAIGO. Yes, sir. We have not yet surrendered. Kuribayashi attempts a smile.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: I served in many far places, but I always hoped to die in my home country. He grips Saigo’s arm.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI
dialogues.text: Hold on to Japan for as long as possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: c

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi releases his grip and looks off into the distance. He sees a stretch of emptiness.
The empty clearing transitions into a long stretch of road across the_PLAINS OF TEXAS.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi’s car travels across the silent plains in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: KURIBAYASHI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Taro, tonight I attended a grand farewell party in my honor with many American friends. When the night was over, they wished me well and though I’m glad to be going home, I felt a bit sad to say Goodbye.. Then I had to make the long drive back to my apartment... If you were here, Taro, I would put you in the passenger’s seat. And Yoko and your mother would be in the back. But it’s lonely driving all by myself. ID_OF S .

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO CLEARING
dialogues.text: Kuribayashi’s eyes glaze and he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: SAIGO
dialogues.text: General!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo struggles, as he drags Kuribayashi’s body over to an area he has picked out. With his shovel, he digs a hole. EXT. KURIBAYASHI’'S CAVE - DAY 169 A group of SWEEP MARINES discover the cave, still smoking from the fire. The Marines surround the cave, their rifles ready.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Come out and-syrrender! There is no response. The Marine nods to another, who throws in a grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo has dug a grave deep enough. He puts down his shovel and drags Kuribayashi’s body. EXT. KURIBAYASHI’S CAVE - DAY 171 The Marines have rigged up a bomb. They run to a safe position. . The MASSIVE EXPLOSION causes the entire CAVE MOUTH to COLLAPSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo hears the EXPLOSION. He quickly finishes covering the grave. He bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines come upon the body of Lt. Fujita.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Careful. His body could be booby- trapped. They approach carefully. One of the Marines sees the trail from Saigo dragging Kuribayashi’s body. He motions to his buddies. The others follow him.

dialogues.speaker: CLEARING
dialogues.text: Saigo is taken by surprise as he emerges from behind the mountains. He has no gun or weapon, except for the shovel. The Marines aim their rifles at him.

dialogues.speaker: E
dialogues.text: g

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Saigo stands still for a moment, at a loss. He glances back towards where his General's body lies.

Finally, he lifts his shovel and waves it at them, ready to fight. The Marines look at each other, wondering whether to shoot or let the poor, haggard soul live. Saigo comes forward, waving his shovel this way and that.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: (in English) Shall I shoot him, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: No, don’t shoot. Saigo growls like a mad man. Lieutenant circles behind Saigo. Finally, Lieutenant knocks him over the head with the butt of his gun. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saigo regains consciousness and squints his eyes open. He lies on a stretcher, awaiting transport to a naval ship. He is bedazzled by the striking colors of an orange sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pitch dark cave. LIGHT suddenly floods the hole. Lt. Ito lies sleeping in the cave, grimy and half naked. He wakes up and is blinded by the light. MARINES carrying flashlights and rifles stare at hin. Lt. Ito slowly puts up his hands in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Excavators unearth the leather satchel that Saigo had buried over fifty years ago. They pull the bag out of the hole. The bag has deteriorated and letters flutter to the ground -- hundreds of undelivered letters. The 0.S. voices of soldiers OVERLAP each other, reading their letters. To their mothers, their wives, their children,

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Father, I resolve to fight to the end for my Emperor and my. country. I shall honor our family name.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Mother, I hope this money will help, as it is all I have left. I won’t be needing anything from now on.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Junko, remember your older brother, and take care of Mother and Father. When the bombs come, remember to run where it will be safe from fire.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I hope to die an honorable soldier. Excavator #2 pulls from the bag, the SKETCHES that Kuribayashi had drawn. CLOSE ON THE SKETCHES as they are handed off to: INT. SHINDO’S HOUSE, TEA ROOM - DAY 178 Kuribayashi’s grandson, YOSHITAKA SHINDO, takes the sketches from Excavator #2, who is now dressed in a suit.

dialogues.speaker: EXCAVATOR
dialogues.text: These sketches by your grandfather were found buried in one of the caves.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shindo looks at the sketches. Doodles of Kuribayashi’s wife and children, smiling, playing. A picture of an automobile, a dinneg party. Happier days. Tears start to well in Shindo’s eyes,

dialogues.speaker: POSTSCRIPT
dialogues.text: The battle for Iwo Jima lasted thirty-six days. The Americans had expected to take the island in five days. Of the roughly 21,000 Japanese troops that defended Iwo Jima, only a little over 1,000 survived. So far, only 8,000 of the bodies have been recovered and excavation continues today to find the remaining 12,000 bodies. Personal items taken as souvenirs are also still being sought for their return to surviving relatives. FADE OUT.
